attributes.action: Make baseball fields in local parks.
attributes.additional_details: Baseball is a great workout, It’s a sport all ages can play, players that play in the UK baseball league can train whilst their club is closed. We as a country can get better in the rankings as there will be more places to practice. It will bring more awareness to the public to try a sport they may have been interested in but couldn’t due to being no baseball fields in a park to play unless you join a team.Baseball equipment & clothing is available in the Uk so why not the fields in local parks.
attributes.background: I would like the Government/Parliament to implement putting baseball fields in the local parks.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local sports facilities are a matter for individual local authorities and leisure facilities, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
